intro: Degenia, commonly known as the "star of Bethlehem," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Liliaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Degenia trichophylla, which is native to South Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosette-forming leaves and produce showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Degenia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their unique appearance.
